intro: Fumaria enneaphylla, commonly known as the nine-leafed fumitory, is a herbaceous annual plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate in shape. Fumaria enneaphylla produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in rocky areas.
